description: Borrowed from Middle French impulsif, from Latin impulsivus.

adjectives.description: impulsive (comparative more impulsive, superlative most impulsive)

entries.meaning: Having the power of driving or impelling; giving an impulse; moving; impellent.
Actuated by impulse or by transient feelings; inclined to make rapid decisions without due consideration.
(mechanics) Acting momentarily, or by impulse; not continuous – said of forces.
That which impels or gives an impulse; an impelling agent.
examples: Notwithstanding all which Motives and impulsives , Sir Thomas Overbury refused to be sent abroad , with such terms

entries.meaning: One whose behaviour or personality is characterized by being impulsive.
